newsitem.title: UK: Man Utd drops, report says clubs overvalued.
newsitem.headline: Man Utd drops, report says clubs overvalued.

text.p: Shares in Manchester United Plc dropped on Monday after a report in the Sunday Telegraph newspaper said a report by accountants Coopers & Lybrand argued that soccer clubs could be overvalued by some one billion stg.

Manchester United shares, which reached a record 737p on January 24, were down 18p at 686 by 1000 GMT. Other soccer stocks also fell with Chelsa Village Plc down 10p at 160 and Sheffield United Plc down 9p at 81.
According to the Sunday Telegraph, the Coopers report argues that most soccer stocks are overvalued on the basis of a model using gate receipts, merchandising, sponsorship and television revenues.
Manchester United shares have been among the strongest performing UK stocks in recent months, rising from around 450p in the middle of last October.
